Name: Stela of Surata
Description: The stela is divided into three registers. The first register depicts the mummiform god Osiris on a block throne. In front of him are an offering table and a man giving adoration. The curved area between the figures is filled with texts.The second register depicts a seated couple in front of an offering table. A man bearing offerings faces them.The third register depicts two pairs of kneeling women, facing the centre. The decorated surface is in very poor condition and all traces of colour are gone.
